alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Gallatin; Grant; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 6:08PM EDT until May 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, Bracken, Gallatin, Grant and Pendleton. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 607 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Although the heaviest rain has ended, additional rainfall over the next hour or two may worsen ongoing high water or flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Williamstown, Falmouth, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Butler, Neville, Morgan, Gene Snyder Airport, Goforth, Greenwood, Catawba, Knoxville, Kincaid Lake State Park, Williamstown Lake, Gardnersville, Marcus, Northcutt, Mckinneysburg, Camp Northward and Mount Auburn.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
